summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Brad Edwards regarding the exchange of a signed protective order and the Non-Prosecution Agreement in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show coordination to finalize legal documents in August 2008.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing clients in the Epstein case, communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office about receiving and sending signed legal documents including a protective order and non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the West Palm Beach office handling the Epstein case, coordinating with defense attorney Brad Edwards to exchange signed protective orders and the non-prosecution agreement.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney coordinating the exchange of legal documents including protective orders and non-prosecution agreements in the Epstein case.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Exchange
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney sends the Non-Prosecution Agreement to defense attorney Brad Edwards after receiving the signed protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney contacts Brad Edwards requesting the signed protective order before sending the agreement.

keyFacts: The document references a 'Non-Prosecution Agreement' with an attached PDF file named 'Epstein_NonProsecution_Agrmt_w_Addendum.pdf'.
The correspondence shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's office and defense counsel to finalize legal documents in August 2008.
Brad Edwards is identified as an attorney representing clients in the Epstein case.
The emails demonstrate the procedural steps required to execute the non-prosecution agreement, including exchange of signed protective orders.
The document contains standard legal confidentiality notices indicating privileged attorney-client communications.
